entries.text: Thank you for calling VeloFit customer support. Your call is important to us. Please wait while we connect you to the next available agent.
Thank you for calling VeloFit, this is Sarah, how can I help you today?
I'm calling about my VeloFit Racer. It's practically brand new, and it's falling apart! I'm extremely frustrated.
I understand your frustration, sir. Can you please tell me more about the issue you are experiencing with your VeloFit Racer?

Well, for starters, the left pedal is completely broken. It just snapped off mid-ride! I almost crashed! And there's a terrible wheel wobble, especially at higher speeds. I'm afraid to even ride the thing.
Okay, I understand. A broken pedal and a wheel wobble. That sounds concerning. Can you provide me with your order number or the serial number of your VeloFit Racer?
Sure, the order number is VF-12345. But that's not the point! I need this bike fixed! It's clearly defective.

Thank you. I have located your order. I see you purchased the VeloFit Racer three months ago. To process this, I need you to take pictures of the broken pedal and the wheel wobble. Also, could you check the frame? We've had a few reports and want to rule out any frame crack issues.
A frame crack?! Are you kidding me? I’m going to have to disassemble the entire bike to take pictures? This is ridiculous! What if I find a frame crack? What are you going to do then?

If you find a frame crack, sir, we'll need further documentation to assess the damage and determine the appropriate course of action. This may involve a warranty claim investigation to see if the issue is covered under our terms, given it might be a defective unit.

Warranty claim investigation? I just told you the pedal is broken! And the wheel is wobbling! It’s obvious it's defective! I don't have time for this. I use this bike for training, and now I'm completely sidelined.

Sir, I understand your frustration. I'm trying to help. The pictures are necessary to document the damage for our records. It's standard procedure. Without them, I can't proceed with any potential replacements or repairs related to the broken pedal or the wheel wobble.

This is unbelievable. So, I have to spend my time disassembling a practically new VeloFit Racer, take pictures, and then wait for you to decide if you're going to fix your defective product? I'm going to report you to the Better Business Bureau. This is a complete waste of my time!

Sir, I apologize that you feel that way. I am following our company policy. If you provide the requested documentation, I can escalate the issue to a supervisor and see if there's anything else we can do to expedite the process. But without the pictures, I am unable to proceed.
I need to speak with a supervisor.
Sir, if you would just allow me to gather the documentation...
Sir? Sir, are you still there?
